Package com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.frontend Description

Frontend presentation layer for the ODP (Ordine di Pagamento) system.

Overview

This package contains the user interface components for the ODP payment order management system. It follows the RDS SimpleForm framework pattern, providing forms, actions, and data binding for web-based interaction with the ODP backend services.

Architecture

 +------------------------------------------+
 |  OdpApp (Application Entry Point)       |
 |  - Form registration                     |
 |  - Session management                    |
 |  - Security configuration                |
 +--------------+---------------------------+
                |
      +---------+-----------+
      v                     v
 +----------+      +--------------+
 |  Forms   |      |   Actions    |
 |  - State |      |   - Events   |
 |  - UI    |      |   - Commands |
 +----+-----+      +------+-------+
      |                   |
      v                   v
 +----------+      +--------------+
 | ERParams |      |   Mappers    |
 | - Fields |      |   - Data     |
 | - Valid. |      |   Transform  |
 +----------+      +--------------+

Core Components

OdpApp

OdpApp is the main application class that:

  • Extends SimpleApplication from the RDS framework
  • Registers all forms (Search, Tasks, Detail, Approval, ChoseCompany)
  • Manages the ODP service instance
  • Maintains the current user session
  • Configures security manager
  • Handles configuration parameters (K1, K2)

OdpAppConstants

OdpAppConstants defines application-wide constants:

  • Form identifiers
  • Action identifiers and descriptions
  • Application ID
  • File paths

OdpAppUtils

OdpAppUtils provides utility methods for frontend operations.

Subpackages

forms

User interface forms extending SimpleForm:

  • OdpSearchForm - Search and filter ODPs with results grid
  • OdpTasksForm - View ODPs assigned to current user (tasks)
  • OdpDetailForm - Create/edit ODP details
  • OdpApprovalForm - Approve/reject ODPs with authorization flow display
  • OdpChoseCompanyForm - Select company before creating ODP

actions

User actions implementing business operations:

  • CreateOdpAction - Create new ODP
  • EditOdpAction - Edit existing ODP
  • UpdateOdpAction - Save changes to ODP
  • NewOdpAction - Initiate new ODP creation
  • SubmitOdpForApprovalAction - Submit ODP for authorization
  • ConfirmApprovalAction - Approve/reject ODP
  • OpenApprovalOdpFormAction - Navigate to approval form
  • ConfirmCompanyAction - Confirm company selection
  • RestoreCsvRepositoryAction - Debug action to restore CSV data

erparams

Form field parameters with validation and data binding:

  • OdpServiceBasedAbstractParam - Base class for service-dependent params
  • OdpCompanyBasedAbstractParam - Base class for company-filtered params
  • OdpCompanyParam - Company selection field
  • OdpCompanyByUserParam - User-filtered company selection
  • OdpCurrencyParam - Currency selection
  • OdpSupplierParam - Supplier selection
  • OdpCDCParam - Cost center selection
  • OdpCDRParam - Revenue center selection
  • OdpAccountVDSParam - Account/VDS selection
  • OdpStateParam - State selection for filtering

mappers

Data transformation between UI and domain models:

  • OdpMapper - Maps between form data and Odp domain objects
  • OdpSearchCriteriaMapper - Maps form data to search criteria

SimpleForm Framework Integration

Form Lifecycle

  1. Initialization - Form creates ERParams and entities
  2. Data Binding - Form data loaded from domain objects via mappers
  3. User Interaction - User modifies fields, triggers actions
  4. Validation - ERParam validators check field values
  5. Action Execution - Action processes data, calls services
  6. Navigation - Action returns next form ID to display

Data Flow

 User Input -> ERParam -> FormEntitiesData -> Mapper -> Domain Model -> Service -> Repository
                                                                           |
 UI <- ERParam <- FormEntitiesData <- Mapper <- Domain Model <- Service <- Repository

Security Integration

OdpSecurityManager

OdpSecurityManager integrates with the framework's security system to:

  • Control action visibility based on user role
  • Enable/disable actions based on ODP state
  • Enforce permissions before action execution

Action Interfaces

Marker interfaces categorize actions for security checks:

  • IManageOdpAction - Create, edit, update, delete operations
  • IApprovalOdpAction - Approval workflow operations
  • IOdpDebugAction - Debug/admin operations

Usage Examples

Form Navigation Flow


 1. User accesses OdpApp
    |
 2. OdpSearchForm displayed (default)
    |
 3. User clicks "New ODP" -> NewOdpAction
    |
 4. OdpChoseCompanyForm displayed
    |
 5. User selects company -> ConfirmCompanyAction
    |
 6. OdpDetailForm displayed (create mode)
    |
 7. User fills form, clicks "Create" -> CreateOdpAction
    |
 8. ODP saved, OdpTasksForm displayed

Accessing ODP Service


 public class SomeAction extends SimpleAction {
     private final OdpDetailForm form;

     public String getNextStateID(boolean validated) throws Exception {
         if (validated) {
             // Get service from application
             IOdpService service = form.getSimpleApplication().getIOdpService();
             OdpUser user = form.getSimpleApplication().getOdpUser();

             // Use service
             Odp odp = ...;
             service.createOdp(odp, user.getUserId());
         }
         return nextFormId;
     }
 }

ERParam Definition


 public class OdpCompanyParam extends OdpServiceBasedAbstractParam<OdpCompany> {
     protected List<OdpCompany> retrieveElements() throws Exception {
         return getIOdpService().retrieveCompanies(getOdpUser());
     }

     protected String getCode(OdpCompany element) {
         return element.getCode();
     }

     protected String getDescription(OdpCompany element) {
         return element.getDescription();
     }
 }
Version:
3.0

RDS Software
